TEXT: The applicant , ORG , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

By an order of DATE , ORG ( hereinafter “ BDEA ” ) granted the applicant the right of use of a small plot of land measuring QUANTITY . The applicant constructed a small workshop on this plot of land , which he used for providing repair services for small household items . According to the applicant , he paid all the relevant taxes and levies related to the plot of land and the business .

On DATE ORG withdrew the plot of land from the applicant ’s use and destroyed his workshop based on an order of ORG concerning the dismantling of small workshops and other constructions which violated the architectural integrity of the city . As a result , the applicant lost his business .
The applicant filed a lawsuit against ORG , claiming that he had been unlawfully deprived of his possessions and demanding the restoration of his workshop .

On DATE the ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim , finding that the workshop had been removed in accordance with the city planning rules and in the public interest . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal and upheld the first - instance judgment . On DATE ORG dismissed the cassation appeal and upheld the lower courts’ judgments .

The applicant filed an additional cassation complaint with the President of ORG , requesting the reopening of the proceedings . The proceedings were reopened and the case was examined by the ORG of ORG . On DATE the ORG quashed ORG decision of DATE and the related judgment of ORG of DATE . The ORG found that the courts had not properly assessed the lawfulness of the destruction of the applicant ’s workshop in the light of the fact that the order granting him the right to use the plot of land had not been repealed . The case was remitted to ORG .

On DATE ORG ruled in the applicant ’s favour and awarded him a compensation of CARDINAL NORP Manats ( GPE . The court found that the applicant had been deprived of his possessions and his business without any lawful compensation .

Both the applicant and ORG filed cassation appeals against this judgment . The applicant claimed that the compensation was too low and demanded MONEY ( ORG ) . BDEA claimed that the compensation was too high and that the applicant had failed to substantiate his claim . On DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment .

Both the applicant and ORG filed cassation appeals against this decision , reiterating their arguments . On DATE the ORG of ORG quashed ORG decision of DATE and the related ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE . The ORG found that the amount of compensation had not been supported by sufficient evidence and that the courts had not properly substantiated their decision to award this amount . The case was again remitted to ORG .

On DATE ORG found that the applicant ’s compensation claim was too high and largely unsubstantiated . The court awarded the applicant CARDINAL NORP ORG ( ORG ) in compensation . The applicant appealed in cassation against this judgment to ORG . As of the date of the present decision on admissibility , ORG has not delivered its final decision .
